command:
import difflib, binascii

base = "/root/baselines/vmlinuz-golden"
cur = "/boot/vmlinuz"

def hexdump_head(p, n=4096):
    with open(p, 'rb') as f:
        data = f.read(n)
    return [binascii.hexlify(data[i:i+16]).decode() + "\n" for i in range(0, len(data), 16)]

print("".join(difflib.unified_diff(hexdump_head(base), hexdump_head(cur), fromfile="baseline_vmlinuz", tofile="current_vmlinuz")))
explanation: Generates a hex-diff of the leading 4 KiB of the kernel image against a golden baseline to spot signs of tampering in the system image.
rationale_steps: Read the head of the current and golden kernel images.
Convert bytes to hex lines for stable textual comparison.
Use difflib unified_diff to highlight any changed regions.
